title: 3 teens arrested after teen, 4-year-old shot in Grand Rapids
content:
GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. — Police say three teens are in jail after a shooting in Grand Rapids Thursday afternoon.
Grand Rapids police say a 17-year-old boy was riding his bicycle when he was shot, while a 4-year-old girl was grazed by a bullet. Both are at an area hospital and are expected to be ok.
GRPD were looking for a man, they believe was driving a dark colored SUV near Houseman and Leonard before firing the shots, hitting the two.
Thursday evening, police were on scene in the area of Bridge and Pine, after a stolen car matching the description of the one at the shooting scene was spotted. That's when police say several suspects took off.
At the scene, police said four to five people were taken into custody and police believe two were still in a home on Pine.
Three hours later, police report one suspect eventually came out and another surrendered to police just after 10 p.m.
Grand Rapids Police Department Major Case Team, Special Response Team, Crisis Negotiation Team, K-9 unit and patrol units were all involved in securing and capturing the suspects.
The shooting remains under investigation.
